OpenSim::ForwardTool

ForwardTool Class Reference

#include <ForwardTool.h>

Inheritance diagram for ForwardTool:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

An abstract class for specifying the interface for an investigation.

Author:
Frank C. Anderson, Chand T. John, Samuel R. Hamner, Ajay Seth
Version:
1.0

Member Data Documentation

PropertyStr _controlsFileNameProp [protected]

Name of the controls file.

std::string& _controlsFileName [protected]

PropertyStr _statesFileNameProp [protected]

Name of the states file.

The states file must at a minimum contain the initial states for a simulation. If a complete set of states is available, the time stamps can be used to specify the integration steps and corrective springs, which allow perturbations, can be added to the simulation.

std::string& _statesFileName [protected]

PropertyStr _pseudoFileNameProp [protected]

Name of the pseudostates file.

Pseudostates are variables that are not integrated but that are dependent on the time history of a simulation. Typically, these are things like the set points for contact elements for example. The pseudostates file must at a minimum contain the initial pseudostates for a simulation. The time stamp on these states should match the time stamp in the states file exactly.

std::string& _pseudoFileName [protected]

OpenSim::PropertyBool _useSpecifiedDtProp [protected]

If true, the time steps from the states file are used during current integration.

bool& _useSpecifiedDt [protected]

OpenSim::PropertyStr _externalLoadsFileNameProp [protected]

Name of the file containing the external loads applied to the model.

std::string& _externalLoadsFileName [protected]

OpenSim::PropertyStr _externalLoadsModelKinematicsFileNameProp [protected]

Name of the file containing the model kinematics corresponding to the external loads.

std::string& _externalLoadsModelKinematicsFileName [protected]

OpenSim::PropertyStr _externalLoadsBody1Prop [protected]

Name of the body to which the first set of external loads should be applied (e.g., the body name for the right foot).

std::string& _externalLoadsBody1 [protected]

OpenSim::PropertyStr _externalLoadsBody2Prop [protected]

Name of the body to which the second set of external loads should be applied (e.g., the body name for the left foot).

std::string& _externalLoadsBody2 [protected]

OpenSim::PropertyDbl _lowpassCutoffFrequencyForLoadKinematicsProp [protected]

Low-pass cut-off frequency for filtering the model kinematics corresponding to the external loads.

A negative value results in no filtering. The default value is -1.0, so no filtering.

double& _lowpassCutoffFrequencyForLoadKinematics [protected]

OpenSim::PropertyBool _outputDetailedResultsProp [protected]

Flag indicating whether or not to output corrective spring loads and other quantities.

bool& _outputDetailedResults [protected]

Force magnitude below which the linear springs start to scale out of effect.

double& _springTransitionEndForce [protected]

PropertyDbl _forceThresholdProp [protected]

Force magnitude below which no corrective linear spring forces are applied.

This allows an unperturbed forward integration to execute with minimal drift.

double& _forceThreshold [protected]

PropertyDbl _torqueThresholdProp [protected]

Torque mangnitude below which no corrective torsional spring foreces are applied.

This allows an unperturbed forward integration to execute with minimal drift.

double& _torqueThreshold [protected]
